ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Loot Rights Question
ygData.msgSnippet: We have quite a few people who do this in our guild...we call them simul-primes... We have two people who play both a warrior and a cleric (one of whom
ygData.messageBody:
We have quite a few people who do this in our guild...we call them
simul-primes...
We have two people who play both a warrior and a cleric (one of whom
recently got a 3rd computer!!!!)
one who is leave of absense but will have a monk/cleric
and a host of others who have two computers and simul on and off

Those who are truly "simul" playing can enter lottos with both characters on
guild hunts (defined as 12 or more from PD) .. However, in the situation you
described the simuled chanter wouldn't have entered because he was really
just following you around for clarity or whatever, not to really play.


On another note, does anyone else have this damn flu going around? *cries*

Halana, 59th Shammy
Tani, 43rd Bard
Paradigm
Solusek Ro

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Windleaf Mistsong [mailto:windleaf@...]
> Sent: Monday, February 12, 2001 11:39 AM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Loot Rights Question
>
>
> I totally agree with Atonal that the "twinked" enchanter
> shouldn't get the
> robe, or even get to roll for the robe. Two people playing 4
> characters is
> a little ridiculous to me, especially on any serious raid.
> For one of those
> people to be the guild leader makes me shudder.
>
> I would have made the same decision had I been in your shoes
> Brilinnia. I
> hope your guildleader hopefully has learned a lesson from
> this incident and
> that your guild can continue to travel the breadth of Norrath
> in camaraderie.
>
> ---Windleaf
>
> At 10:10 AM 2/12/01 -0500, you wrote:
> >Looks pretty simple to me.
> >
> >Chanter #1 is being played, and died doing his job.
> >
> >Chanter #2 is there only because someone has multiple computers with
> >multiple accounts, and is doing nothing, and continued to do
> nothing despite
> >the fact that your group was being overrun, and was even
> gated out safe and
> >sound.
> >
> >I'm a bit surprised that the leader of a guild that attracts
> people such as
> >yourself would be the center of such a disagreement.
> Granted, I don't know
> >your guild leader, but I do know you, and I supposed I've
> always assumed
> >that your conduct is representative of Excalibur. :) I'm
> sure this has
> >caused strife internally, as threats to walk should not be
> taken lightly. A
> >momentary lapse of reason, perhaps?
> >
> >Atonal
> >
> >-----Original Message-----
> >From: Rebecca Small [mailto:rsmall@...]
> >Sent: Monday, February 12, 2001 9:12 AM
> >To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> >Subject: [eqbards] Loot Rights Question
> >
> >
> >Hail bards and bardettes,
> >
> > We had a loot rights discussion this weekend. We had 2
> groups together in
> >Howling Stones North Tower. One group had a L44 chanter, a
> 50s shaman, a 50s
> >warrior, 50s cleric all played by 2 people plus a 50s wiz.
> The chanter
> >really didn't function as a chanter and we'd asked them not
> to bring her
> >along as we had a real working chanter in our group. We got
> to the last
> >corner before the Crypt keeper's room and when the monk
> pulled it, the whole
> >room came. We killed the Crypt Keeper but had alot of mobs on us. Our
> >chanter was doing his best to pause/mez what he could. Then
> the hallway
> >started to respawn and we had 8 -10 mobs. Our chanter died,
> I was doing what
> >I could but out numbered by live awake mobs. We called for
> gates and the
> >other groups wiz got them out. We all died. The necro in our
> group looted
> >the chanter robe (Siren's?) off the keeper before he died
> and I got the key
> >before I died rather than have it poof. The aftermath was
> they wanted to
> >lotto the robe between the chanter twink and the chanter who
> died doing CC.
> >We felt this would be very wrong yet they didn't see it. We
> felt the twink,
> >while there when the robe dropped, was not being played,
> else we probably
> >would not have been wiped out. We also all know that char is
> a twink, not a
> >primary. I think that robe on a twink would hurt our guild's
> credibility
> >somewhat as the twink belongs to the head of the guild. It's also our
> >opinion you can't function as a good chanter unless the
> person is giving the
> >character their whole attention. I'd like to hear the
> opinion of others on
> >this. Were we out of line?
> >The result was I said we'd walk on the guild if they
> insisted on lottoing
> >it. They agreed to give the robe to the other chanter.
> >
> >Brilinnia Ban'Sidhe
> >Excalibur, Xegony
> >
> >
> >Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> lol@...
> >with the subject submissions.
> >
> >
> >Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to
> lol@...
> >with the subject submissions.
>
>
